description: Essentials of normal nutrition and their relationships to the health of individuals and families. These concepts serve as a basis for the development of an understanding of the therapeutic application of dietary principles and the nurse's role and responsibility in this facet of patient care.
name: FUNDAMENTALS OF NUTRITION

values.comments:
Essentials of normal nutrition and their relationships to the health of individuals and families.  These concepts serve as a basis for the development of an understanding of the therapeutic application of dietary principles and the nurse's role and responsibility in this facet of patient care.

	Students found this course “disorganized” and “boring.” In addition, the grading system, allowing for a maximum of 90/100 on homework, left the majority of students very upset. 

	Students were also concerned by the lack of communication among instructors, noting that it made expectations very unclear to them.

The prerequisites for this course are NURS 061 and 062.

Essentials of normal nutrition and their relationships to the health of individuals and families.  These concepts serve as a basis for the development of an understanding of the therapeutic application of dietary principles and the nurse's role and responsibility in this facet of patient care.

	Students found the work for this course fairly easy, as all of the material came directly from the textbook. However, this caused some to feel that the actual class time was useless.

	Major concern was expressed regarding the grading rubric, where homework receives a maximum credit of 90/100. This policy made it difficult to get an A in the course even when the material was relatively straightforward.

	The prerequisites for this course are NURS 061 and 062.
